intro: Leucopogon leptanthus, commonly known as the slender-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in coastal dunes and sandy habitats. Its small, white or pinkish flowers bloom in the spring, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that are important for local wildlife. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
